channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti on olive tree planters, 12th November
item.description:
Graffiti on the 3 olive tree planters on the junction of Chadwick and Bellenden rd by the p13 bustop. Planters were made and funded by the greener , safer fund many years ago m
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Lyndhurst Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge A-board obstructing the footway, 12th November
item.description:
An enormous A-board advertising Boxhall is regularly obstructing the very busy eastern footway of Old Broad Street outside the entrance to The Arcade, by number 71. The City's current transport strategy rightly places great emphasis on keeping our footways free of obstructions, and a clear policy of no permission for A-boards is top of the list of actions listed in Outcome 3, Proposal 16, on page 62 of the City of London's transport strategy, second edition October 2024. Please advise the business owner that they do not have permission and enforce if necessary. The thousands of people who use this narrow footway daily will be grateful.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Old Broad Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load (Estates)

item.title: Resident’s wall collapsing, 12th November
item.description:
On the corner of Edgebury and Belmont Lane, a resident’s wall has a large crack ( possibly caused by trees) and is leaning towards the footpath. Potential danger of collapse and especially serious as this is a road where many children walk past on the way to Edgebury Primary School. Owner needs to be made aware of this and eliminate danger.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edgebury, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Full council waste bin, 12th November
item.description:
The public bin located outside the Portman square Garden opposite to the Hyaat Hotel is full of litter. There are also two bags dumped near the bin. The bin needs to be emptied and waste needs to be completed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71-73, Upper Berkeley Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Countdown unit not working, 12th November
item.description:
As shown in the picture, the coundown display is working but it's failing to connect, instead showing the Stop ID and obfuscated IP addresses for itself and the CSI1 server to which it's presumably failing to connect. This has been happening frequently at this bus stop over several years. What is the underlying problem, I wonder?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsland Road, Shoreditch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Princess road, 12th November
item.description:
There are a number of street lights out along Princess Road which have been out for months and also reported a number of times by other residents. Please replace the bulbs for nighttime safety. Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Princess Road, London

item.title: Dangerous wall, 12th November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cleanthus Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction at northern corner of Russell Square, 12th November
item.description:
Incredibly dangerous!! Can't believe that other reports on Fixmystreet and TfL have been closed on the grounds that this has been 'reported' to the operators. It needs fixing as an emergency. The temporary traffic lights stay red for many minutes at a time and then go green for multiple streams of traffic and pedestrians at once. This is a serious accident waiting to happen. It's clearly not fixed as I can hear the honking from here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Russell Square, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Central reservation lampost height bollard light not working, 12th November
item.description:
The tall bollard type street lamp in the middle of the road is not working. Location is postcode SW5 9LP near corner of Denmark Road and Knatchbull Road. This is dangerous as it is a busy crossing and is now very dark at night. See photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knatchbull Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet
